page.title: 11Places of worship
page.content: Alkerton church is mostly Norman and like Shenington, it has a Norman arch. The arch is not as patterned. Alkerton church is made of Horton stone. The nave roof is decorated with a parapet resting on a stone cornice. On it are sculptured figures of men with instruments and you can quite easily pick out a man with an organ and a man with a harp. In the 16th century most of the chancel was rebuilt. The bells cannot be rung because it is not safe. The church and grounds are immaculate. At Balscote the Chapel of St Mary Magdalene consists of chancel, nave, S aisle & SW tower. It is 12th C. The Methodist Chapel was built in 1850. At Shutford 12th C St Martin's church. The nave was rebuilt in 14 C, chancel in 1862, 15 C oak screen. The Methodist chapel opened in 1826 but closed in 1950.
